features: 【Three-Level Adjustable Ring Fill Light】The built-in ring light provides 3-light Modes (with simple touch) and stepless adjustable brightness (with touch and press). You can achieve your ideal brightness level by touching and holding the ring light in dim light environments. Brighter than many other webcams with built-in lights, the light has a soft tone so that it doesn't create a glare.

【60FPS 1080p Webcam with Auto Focus】The NexiGo FHD Webcam comes with high definition 1920 x 1080p resolution at up to 60 frames per second (fps) refresh rate, and our enhanced autofocus helps to capture videos that are as accurate and true-to-life as possible.

【Webcam with Built-in Privacy Shutter】The NexiGo webcam works with a USB-A port. No additional driver is required. The built-in privacy cover allows you to enjoy safe digital web life when not in use and prevents hackers from spying on you. It is perfect to provide privacy, security, and peace of mind to individuals, groups, organizations, companies, and governments.

【Built-in Microphone】The built-in microphone with noise-canceling technology reduces ambient noise to enhance the sound quality of your video. Even in noisy surroundings, you can capture just the sounds that you want.

【Widely Compatible】The NexiGo webcam is compatible with multiple operating systems. The webcam is compatible with Windows XP/7/8/10/11, Mac OS 10.6 or higher, Linux 2.6.24 or higher, Chrome OS 29.0.1547 or higher, and Ubuntu Version 10.04 or higher.

Does this webcam support 1080p at 60fps? Yes, It supports 1920 x 1080p resolution at up to 60 frames per second (fps) refresh rate. Can the light be turned off? Yes, this light can be turned off, just simply touch the top. Can this privacy cover be removable? No, the N960E webcam is Built-in Privacy Shutter, If you don't use it, you can slide the protruding flap at the bottom to close it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid Camera for Remote Work
reviews.reviewText: With my usual remote-work setup, my laptop's built-in camera isn't an option, as I use attached monitors instead of the laptop screen. That's really no loss, as the built-in camera is...let's go with poor quality to be charitable. But that means I'm in need of a decent webcam and a light, as my workspace does have a window that faces me, the daylight can be obscured by the trees outside, the shadow of my monitor and plain old clouds or darkness.While I'm not so sure it's necessarily a good thing for my colleagues that this camera/light combination is good quality, as they're stuck seeing me relatively clearly, it does provide a professional appearance that's a step up from the older, lower quality webcam I had been using. With the light built in, it also saves me space atop my monitor, and a USB slot since I need only one.For some context, my most usual conferencing service is Teams, and I use a separate headset/microphone. With that in mind, I've found this camera to be reliable, easy to use and capable of delivering a high-quality video call. I also use a portable green screen behind me most days so that the background feature in Teams works a little better, and this camera is far better than my previous one at making the background look smooth--few weird bits of my room/screen tend to show on the screen, just me and the backdrop.The 1080p quality is noticeable, and that's the step up from my older 720 camera. I look...less fuzzy, for lack of a better term. I can still soften the focus with Teams's filters. I always looked a little harsh on the previous camera, now I look more "real," without the odd sort of jagged edges. The built in light also helps with that, as it directly surrounds the camera, instead of needing to be mounted next to it, and angled awkwardly, creating an inevitable "Phantom of the Opera" type shadow effect on my face. I also wear glasses, and while I do sometimes see some reflection of the light with this camera and light, it is nowhere near as bad as the annoying circle of light I would see reflected in my lenses before, with a fairly standard ring light setup. The light has three modes (I usually prefer the cool mode) and you can control the brightness by holding the button at the top of the camera (a light tap switches mode, a press and hold changes the brightness).I'm also a fan of the somewhat narrower field of view on this camera, 78 degrees. While still considered wide, this is, to me, far better for a single user than the 90+ degree cameras out there. Those tended to make me as one person on screen look ridiculously small relative to the background. It also might be better to have a narrower field of view if you want to keep people from having too much of a look around you at home.Also easy to use is the built-in privacy slider. In lieu of an obvious cover over the lens, you simply slide a lever and a red disc slips over there camera letting you know it's covered up and should slide it back before trying to go on camera.All things considered, I'm quite happy with this webcam/light combination. It's been an improvement to my remote working, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun and functional
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Nexigo webcam. I have the N940E with ring light that I use for work at the office, as my office is dark. I got this one to use at home, where the light changes all day long. Today I had the opportunity to run the webcam through a variety of lighting environments and to test it under all-day use. I on Zoom all day one day a week, so I was just itching to give it a go. I fiddled around with it for a few hours yesterday to get used to the remote and familiarize myself with the settings. This camera is different from my other one but they use the same software. Interestingly, my N940E doesn't give me the option to adjust the hue, gamma, or backlight comp, or to set gain, focus or roll, the Nexigo software does not allow me to change the hue or the roll. I wonder if different cameras have different customizations. I will do some more research on that at a later date. As far as this particular camera goes, I find the customization adequate. I mostly want to be able to soften my face and use a couple of Zoom filters if I don't feel like going full makeup and I was able to do that today. I like the remote control a lot. It is very responsive and it has a number of functions, including 2 presets. I saved one of my favorite setting configurations today and it was quick and easy to do. All in all I have to say I really like this webcam. The 5x Zoom is awesome. It works well and does not distort the view at all. I have included some shots from today with different settings. I like the last one best, as it is the most realistic, but the others are softer and gave me a little more color, which I can always use. The one shortcoming I am still trying to figure out is that when the lighting changes significantly, the camera does not seem to adjust for that. I had to manually change settings to compensate. It's very quick and easy, but it would be great if the camera automatically adjusted.If you are on the fence about this camera, I would say go for it. I got it for $20 off, I assume because there is a newer version just coming out, and that was what tipped me over the edge. I feel like it was a smart purchase for as much as I am on Zoom these days.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Solid camera with some minor frustrations
reviews.reviewText: I bought this camera both for work and for discord calls with my buds. This camera, overall, is a mostly high quality product and is definitely an upgrade over my previous webcam. Hardware-wise, the unit is very solid, with mounting solutions for both on monitor and a hole on the bottom for a tripod, which is a nice touch.Installation was completely plug and play; worked within seconds on my Windows 10 machine.The picture quality is excellent, and definitely a testament to the value of upgrading to a 4K camera. The automatic backlight compensation (activated by a button on the remote) works well, and helps since I’ve got a bright window right next to my desk. Speaking of the remote, it’s super handy to be able to adjust settings on the fly, rather than having to go into software each time you need to change something.The microphone built into the camera is decent, but you might be better off having a dedicated mic. However, the active noise cancellation used works quite well, eliminating any background noise from my stream.Finally, as other reviewers have mentioned, the manual for this thing can sometimes be unclear, not really explaining the function of some options. However, with a little messing around I found it pretty easy to figure out. Another snag is that when you switch between some options on the camera, such as turning the backlight compensation on/off, you have no indication whatsoever on the camera itself, so it’s hard to gauge what options you have enabled. Another reviewer mentioned hitting the home button when you turn it on, which sets everything back to default, and THEN activating the buttons. I’ve found this method to be my go-to.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Complete Webcam Package: NexiGo N960E Delivers Impressive Performance
reviews.reviewText: The NexiGo N960E 1080P 60FPS Webcam with Light is a game-changer in the world of webcams, offering a comprehensive package that combines exceptional video quality, advanced features, and thoughtful design.Whether you're a professional content creator, remote worker, or a casual video communicator, this webcam is poised to elevate your virtual interactions to a whole new level.Video Quality and Frame Rate:The standout feature of the NexiGo N960E is its stellar video quality.With a true 1080P resolution and smooth 60FPS frame rate, your image is crisp, clear, and lifelike.This is especially beneficial for video conferencing, streaming, or recording videos where every detail matters.The higher frame rate ensures that motion remains fluid and natural, making it a breeze to showcase your content.Built-in Light:The integrated light sets the NexiGo N960E apart from other webcams on the market.The adjustable light ensures that you're perfectly illuminated, regardless of your lighting conditions.Whether you're working in a dimly lit room or a bright environment, the webcam's light compensates beautifully, allowing your face to be well-lit and your expressions clearly visible.Fast AutoFocus:One of the pain points of older webcams has been their struggle to maintain focus, especially when you're moving around or presenting items up close.The NexiGo N960E's fast autofocus feature addresses this issue splendidly.It locks onto your face or any object quickly and accurately, saving you the frustration of blurry images during critical moments.Software Inclusion:The inclusion of software with the webcam adds significant value to the package.The software offers intuitive controls for adjusting various settings, such as brightness, contrast, saturation, and white balance.It's refreshing to have the ability to fine-tune your video output according to your preferences without relying solely on default settings.Design and Build:The NexiGo N960E boasts a sleek and minimalistic design that easily blends with any setup.The adjustable clip allows for easy mounting on laptops, monitors, or tripods, ensuring flexibility in placement.The camera itself feels sturdy and well-built, exuding a sense of durability and longevity.Conclusion:In a market flooded with webcams, the NexiGo N960E stands out as a versatile and high-performing option. Its superior video quality, 60FPS frame rate, built-in light, fast autofocus, and included software make it an exceptional tool for a range of applications.Whether you're a content creator looking to enhance your videos or a professional seeking top-notch video conferencing capabilities, this webcam has you covered.The NexiGo N960E is undoubtedly a worthy investment that brings a new level of professionalism to your virtual presence.
Easy to use, zoom works in all apps and is clear. Light adjustment works well also. Best for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sehr hochwertige Webcam, problemloses Plug and Play
reviews.reviewText: Autofokus funktioniert sehr gut, keine Installation, USB Stecker rein - fertig. "Echtes" Plug and Play. Bilder sind sehr scharf, und farblich perfekt widergegeben. Das Ringlicht bietet drei Farbtöne und wirkt erstaunlich weit in den Raum hinein. Mikrophon ist ebenso hochwertig, überträgt auch aus Entfernung klangscharf. Der Verschluss der Linse ist dann das I Tüpfelchen. Perfekte Webcam, klare Weiterempfehlung, Preise Leistung definitiv angemessen!
